intro: Geonoma triglochin, commonly known as the slender arrowleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. The plant typically grows as a small shrub with narrow, strap-like leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of trichomes. Geonoma triglochin is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitats.
